meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insatiable.
meanings.sent1: Her insatiabilities for knowledge led her to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent2: His insatiabilities for adventure drove him to explore new lands.
meanings.sent3: The insatiabilities of the curious cat always got him into trouble.
meanings.sent4: The insatiabilities of the ocean seemed to never be quenched by the rain.
meanings.sent5: The insatiabilities of the young artist fueled her creativity and passion.

meanings.definition: The inability to be satisfied or appeased.
meanings.sent1: Their insatiabilities for success pushed them to work harder each day.
meanings.sent2: The insatiabilities of the hungry child could never be satisfied with just one cookie.
meanings.sent3: The insatiabilities of the picky eater made it challenging to find a restaurant they liked.
meanings.sent4: The insatiabilities of the storm seemed to demand more and more lightning.
meanings.sent5: The insatiabilities of the demanding boss left the employees feeling overwhelmed.
